back_cards.definition_en: A sport played with a ball kicked between two teams.
back_cards.example_en: We watched a football match at the stadium.

back_cards.definition_en: The ball used in the sport of football.
back_cards.example_en: He kicked the football into the goal.

back_cards.definition_en: A community or school activity.
back_cards.example_en: She joined the football team in high school.

back_cards.definition_en: A topic of social conversation.
back_cards.example_en: Football is always discussed at the bar.

back_cards.definition_en: A professional or competitive event.
back_cards.example_en: The football league finals are next week.

back_cards.definition_en: Having a pleasant taste, like sugar.
back_cards.example_en: The sweet candy melted in her mouth.

back_cards.definition_en: Kind or thoughtful in nature.
back_cards.example_en: His sweet gesture made her smile.

back_cards.definition_en: Pleasing or charming in a gentle way.
back_cards.example_en: The baby’s sweet laugh filled the room.

back_cards.definition_en: Describing a pleasant scent or flavor.
back_cards.example_en: The sweet aroma of flowers greeted us.

back_cards.definition_en: Expressing affection or endearment.
back_cards.example_en: She wrote a sweet note to her friend.

back_cards.definition_en: The lack of success in achieving a goal.
back_cards.example_en: The project’s failure taught us valuable lessons.

back_cards.definition_en: An instance of something not working.
back_cards.example_en: The engine failure caused the car to stop.

back_cards.definition_en: A person or thing that does not succeed.
back_cards.example_en: He felt like a failure after the exam.

back_cards.definition_en: A breakdown in a process or system.
back_cards.example_en: The power failure left the city dark.

back_cards.definition_en: Not meeting expectations or standards.
back_cards.example_en: The product was a failure in the market.

back_cards.definition_en: A journalist who gathers and presents news.
back_cards.example_en: The reporter interviewed the mayor for the story.

back_cards.definition_en: A person covering events for media.
back_cards.example_en: A sports reporter commented on the game.

back_cards.definition_en: Someone who provides updates in a professional setting.
back_cards.example_en: The field reporter shared the latest findings.

back_cards.definition_en: A role in broadcast or print journalism.
back_cards.example_en: She dreamed of being a reporter for a big network.

back_cards.definition_en: A person investigating and documenting issues.
back_cards.example_en: The reporter exposed corruption in the city.

back_cards.definition_en: To pledge or dedicate to a cause or action.
back_cards.example_en: She committed to volunteering every weekend.

back_cards.definition_en: To carry out or perform an act, often negative.
back_cards.example_en: The suspect committed a robbery last night.

back_cards.definition_en: To entrust or assign responsibility.
back_cards.example_en: They committed the project to a new team.

back_cards.definition_en: To bind oneself to a relationship or agreement.
back_cards.example_en: He committed to a two-year contract.

back_cards.definition_en: To allocate resources or time.
back_cards.example_en: The company committed funds to research.

back_cards.definition_en: To engage in physical conflict.
back_cards.example_en: The two boys fought over the toy.

back_cards.definition_en: To struggle or work hard for a cause.
back_cards.example_en: She fights for equal rights every day.

back_cards.definition_en: To argue or dispute verbally.
back_cards.example_en: They fought about where to eat dinner.

back_cards.definition_en: To resist or oppose something.
back_cards.example_en: He fought the urge to eat another cookie.

back_cards.definition_en: To compete intensely in a contest.
back_cards.example_en: The team fought to win the championship.

back_cards.definition_en: A single person or thing.
back_cards.example_en: One of the apples was rotten.

back_cards.definition_en: An unspecified individual.
back_cards.example_en: One should always be kind to others.

back_cards.definition_en: The number 1 in counting.
back_cards.example_en: She bought one ticket for the show.

back_cards.definition_en: A particular item or example.
back_cards.example_en: This one is my favorite book.

back_cards.definition_en: Used to refer to a shared experience.
back_cards.example_en: One never forgets their first trip abroad.

back_cards.definition_en: To connect or link with someone or something.
back_cards.example_en: I associate the smell of pine with winter.

back_cards.definition_en: To work or interact with others.
back_cards.example_en: She associates with a group of artists.

back_cards.definition_en: To relate one idea to another.
back_cards.example_en: He associates success with hard work.

back_cards.definition_en: To join or partner in a professional context.
back_cards.example_en: They associate with top firms in tech.

back_cards.definition_en: To imply a connection in a discussion.
back_cards.example_en: The color red is associated with passion.

back_cards.definition_en: The ability to see.
back_cards.example_en: Her vision is perfect after getting glasses.

back_cards.definition_en: A mental image of the future goal.
back_cards.example_en: His vision for the company is innovative.

back_cards.definition_en: Insight or foresight in planning.
back_cards.example_en: The leader’s vision inspired the team.

back_cards.definition_en: A vivid imagination or dream.
back_cards.example_en: She had a vision of a peaceful world.

back_cards.definition_en: A visual experience in a spiritual context.
back_cards.example_en: The prophet described a divine vision.

back_cards.definition_en: The purpose or role of something.
back_cards.example_en: The function of a hammer is to drive nails.

back_cards.definition_en: A mathematical relationship or operation.
back_cards.example_en: The function f(x) equals x squared.

back_cards.definition_en: A social or official event.
back_cards.example_en: The charity function raised thousands.

back_cards.definition_en: A feature or capability of a device.
back_cards.example_en: This phone has a new camera function.

back_cards.definition_en: A task or duty in a system.
back_cards.example_en: Her function in the team is to organize.

back_cards.definition_en: In a genuine or sincere manner.
back_cards.example_en: I truly appreciate your help today.

back_cards.definition_en: To emphasize the truth of a statement.
back_cards.example_en: This is truly the best cake I’ve eaten.

back_cards.definition_en: Completely or fully in a situation.
back_cards.example_en: She is truly dedicated to her job.

back_cards.definition_en: Accurately or exactly as stated.
back_cards.example_en: The story is truly based on real events.

back_cards.definition_en: Expressing deep authenticity.
back_cards.example_en: He truly loves spending time in nature.

back_cards.definition_en: Physically or mentally unwell.
back_cards.example_en: She stayed home because she was sick.

back_cards.definition_en: Feeling nauseated or disgusted.
back_cards.example_en: The smell made him feel sick.

back_cards.definition_en: Tired of or annoyed with something.
back_cards.example_en: I’m sick of hearing the same excuse.

back_cards.definition_en: Informally, impressive or cool.
back_cards.example_en: That skateboard trick was sick!

back_cards.definition_en: Describing severe or extreme conditions.
back_cards.example_en: The storm caused sick damage to the crops.

back_cards.definition_en: Typical or normal in amount or quality.
back_cards.example_en: The average temperature today is 70 degrees.

back_cards.definition_en: Calculated as a mean value.
back_cards.example_en: Her average score in math is 85.

back_cards.definition_en: Ordinary or not exceptional.
back_cards.example_en: He’s an average student in the class.

back_cards.definition_en: Common or standard in a group.
back_cards.example_en: The average commute takes 30 minutes.

back_cards.definition_en: Balanced or moderate in nature.
back_cards.example_en: They live an average, quiet life.

back_cards.definition_en: A person or member of the species Homo sapiens.
back_cards.example_en: Every human deserves respect and dignity.

back_cards.definition_en: The collective of people or humanity.
back_cards.example_en: The discovery benefited all humans.

back_cards.definition_en: A being with emotions and flaws.
back_cards.example_en: To err is human, so don’t worry.

back_cards.definition_en: A subject of study in science or philosophy.
back_cards.example_en: Humans evolved over millions of years.

back_cards.definition_en: An individual in a social context.
back_cards.example_en: The kind human helped the lost child.

back_cards.definition_en: Lacking intelligence or common sense.
back_cards.example_en: That was a stupid mistake to make.

back_cards.definition_en: Annoying or frustrating in a situation.
back_cards.example_en: This stupid phone keeps freezing.

back_cards.definition_en: Unimportant or trivial in context.
back_cards.example_en: They argued over a stupid detail.

back_cards.definition_en: Informally, reckless or careless.
back_cards.example_en: His stupid decision cost the team.

back_cards.definition_en: Describing something foolishly designed.
back_cards.example_en: The stupid lock broke after one use.

back_cards.definition_en: A legal document stating one’s wishes after death.
back_cards.example_en: She updated her will to include her niece.

back_cards.definition_en: The mental faculty of determination or resolve.
back_cards.example_en: His strong will helped him finish the race.

back_cards.definition_en: A desire or intention.
back_cards.example_en: The will of the people shaped the policy.

back_cards.definition_en: A deliberate choice or purpose.
back_cards.example_en: She acted against her parents’ will.

back_cards.definition_en: A force of persistence or effort.
back_cards.example_en: With enough will, you can achieve anything.

back_cards.definition_en: Relating to the people or culture of China.
back_cards.example_en: She loves Chinese festivals like Lunar New Year.

back_cards.definition_en: Describing the language spoken in China.
back_cards.example_en: He’s learning Chinese for his trip.

back_cards.definition_en: Pertaining to food from Chinese cuisine.
back_cards.example_en: We ordered Chinese dumplings for dinner.

back_cards.definition_en: Associated with products made in China.
back_cards.example_en: The Chinese smartphone brand is popular.

back_cards.definition_en: Referring to historical or artistic traditions.
back_cards.example_en: The museum displayed Chinese pottery.

back_cards.definition_en: A relationship or link between people or things.
back_cards.example_en: Their connection grew stronger over time.

back_cards.definition_en: A means of communication or transport.
back_cards.example_en: The train connection to the city is fast.

back_cards.definition_en: A digital or technological link.
back_cards.example_en: My internet connection is really slow.

back_cards.definition_en: An association or relevance to something.
back_cards.example_en: The connection to the case was unclear.

back_cards.definition_en: A personal or emotional bond.
back_cards.example_en: She felt a connection with the new team.

back_cards.definition_en: A place for outdoor recreation or training.
back_cards.example_en: The kids went to summer camp by the lake.

back_cards.definition_en: A temporary shelter or lodging site.
back_cards.example_en: The hikers set up camp in the forest.

back_cards.definition_en: A group with shared beliefs or goals.
back_cards.example_en: She’s in the camp that supports reform.

back_cards.definition_en: A program for learning or activities.
back_cards.example_en: He attended a coding camp last month.

back_cards.definition_en: A military or survival training area.
back_cards.example_en: The soldiers trained at the desert camp.

back_cards.definition_en: A small piece of rock or mineral.
back_cards.example_en: She skipped a stone across the pond.

back_cards.definition_en: A material used in building or carving.
back_cards.example_en: The house was made of gray stone.

back_cards.definition_en: A gem or precious rock.
back_cards.example_en: Her ring had a sparkling stone.

back_cards.definition_en: A unit of weight, equal to 14 pounds.
back_cards.example_en: He lost two stone after exercising.

back_cards.definition_en: A marker or monument, often for graves.
back_cards.example_en: The stone bore the family’s name.
